text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle duplicate patient records during import?

text: ZOLL Billing uses a weighted algorithm to determine if a new patient record is a match of an existing patient record when claims are imported or manually created. The algorithm gives points to each matching criteria, such as social security number, date of birth, first name, last name, address, etc. If a possible duplicate exists, the system presents the patient data and asks you to choose the correct information.

text.text: What steps should I follow to identify duplicate patient records during claim import in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you import a PCR, ZOLL Billing searches for existing patient records containing the same name, date of birth, and/or address. If one or more records exist, a TBD displays in the "Claim #" column. You will need to verify whether the patient information on the imported PCR is a duplicate before you create the claim.

text.text: Can you explain the process of using Merge Patient to handle duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Merge Patients functionality displays on the Account page when there is a possible duplicate patient record. A possible duplicate record is one where the name, address, date of birth, or social security number matches that of the record you are viewing. The system merges the two patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID. You can merge as many patient records as needed until all the duplicates are gone.

text.text: What happens if ZOLL Billing detects possible duplicate patient records during import?

text: If the system does not have issues with the patient on the imported claim (the patient is not a possible duplicate of an existing patient record), then the imported claim will display in the 'Incomplete' workflow button on the Dashboard.

text.text: Is there a way to merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing? If yes, how?

text: Yes, there is a way to merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing. To merge duplicate patient records, you can use the Merge Patients functionality on the Account page. The Merge Patients functionality displays when there is a possible duplicate patient record. A possible duplicate record is one where the name, address, date of birth, or social security number matches that of the record you are viewing. The system merges the two patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID. You can merge as many patient records as needed until all the duplicates are gone.

text.text: How can I find and merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing using Merge Patient?

text:
To find and merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing using Merge Patient, follow these steps:

1. On the Account page, click the Merge Patients link.
2. In the Search field, enter the patient's name, address, date of birth, or social security number.
3. Click the Search button.
4. The system displays a list of possible duplicate patient records.
5. Select the patient records that you want to merge.
6. Click the Merge button.
7. The system merges the selected patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID.

text.text: What information does ZOLL Billing use to identify duplicate patient records during import?

text: ZOLL Billing uses the following information to identify duplicate patient records during import:: ZOLL Billing tries to minimize duplicates by constantly comparing the name, SSN, address, and date of birth of existing records with the information being entered/imported. If a possible duplicate exists, the system presents the patient data and asks you to choose the correct information.

text.text: Where can I view the merge history of patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can view the merge history of patient records on the Edit Patient page. You can also view the merge history by clicking View merge history at the top right of the patient's Account page.

text.text: What should I do if ZOLL Billing encounters an error while merging duplicate patient records?

text: If ZOLL Billing encounters an error while merging duplicate patient records, the system will display an error message at the top of the Merge Patient page. You must correct the conflict before you can merge the patient records.

text.text: How do I verify if an imported claim in ZOLL Billing is a duplicate or not?

text: When you import a claim, a message sometimes displays asking you to verify if the claim is a duplicate or if you want to merge this claim with an existing claim. It can be confusing to understand why you get one message over the other. If the imported claim has the same patient account name, service date and run number, you will be asked if it is a duplicate claim. If it is not a duplicate, click Yes, create a new claim.

text.text: Can I create a new claim if an imported claim in ZOLL Billing is not a duplicate?

text: If the imported claim is not a duplicate, you can create a new claim. To do this, you need to check the list of existing patient records. If you see a match, select it. If not, select Nope to create a new patient record.

text.text: What options do I have if I encounter a possible duplicate claim during import

text: If you encounter a possible duplicate claim during import, you can use Merge Patients to consolidate as many patient records as you wish into one patient record. When you merge patient records, all claims associated with the records remain the same. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number, in their Inbox.

text.text: Where can I access the Merge Patient feature in ZOLL Billing?

text: The Merge Patients feature is located on the Account page. To access the Merge Patients feature, click the Merge Patients link.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of patient records I can merge at once

text: You can merge as many patient records as needed until all duplicates are gone. You can view a list of records that were merged by clicking View merge history.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of using Merge Patient to consolidate duplicate patient records?

text: To use Merge Patient to consolidate duplicate patient records, you can follow these steps: 1. Click Admin > Billing > Patients 2. Use search to find a patient name 3. Click the patient name 4. Click View similar records to see a list of possible duplicates 5. Click the radio button next to the duplicate patient's name.

text.text: Is there a way to resolve conflicts when merging patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: To resolve conflicts when merging patient records in ZOLL Billing, you must first correct the conflict before you can merge the patient records. You can then click Merge to combine the two records. The new patient account created by the two merged patient records will display.

text.text: How can I access the Merge History to view all merged patient records

text: To view the merge history, you can click View merge history. This will show a list of records that were merged to create a new patient record. You can also use Merge History on the Edit Patient page to view all merged records.

text.text: What should I do if ZOLL Billing displays an error message while trying to merge duplicate patient records?

text: If ZOLL Billing displays an error message while trying to merge duplicate patient records, you must correct the conflict before you can merge the patient records.

text.text: Can I merge duplicate patient records from the Admin > Billing > Patients section in ZOLL Billing?

text: To merge duplicate patient records, you can use Merge Patients from the Billing > Patient billing > Merge & restore patients section. This will consolidate one or more duplicates into one patient record. You can also use Merge History on the Edit Patient page to view all merged records.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of patient records I can merge at once using Merge Patient in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can merge as many patient records as needed until all duplicates are gone.

text.text: What information do I need to verify before merging duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: ZOLL Billing uses a weighted algorithm to determine if a new patient record is a match of an existing patient record. The algorithm gives points to each of the following matching criteria: Social security number: 100 Date of birth: 30 First name: 9 Middle name: 2 Last name: 34 Address: Address line 1: 6 Address line 2: 2 City: 6 State: 5 Zip: 6 Name is similar or sounds like: Based on the both the first and last names - this criteria returns a: 0-3 = not very similar 4 = strongly similar or identical (considered a match)

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle conflicts between duplicate patient records during the merge process?

text: If there are any conflicts, the system displays an error message at the top of the Merge Patient page. You must correct the conflict before you can merge the patient records.

text.text: Can I merge patient records with conflicting data in ZOLL Billing?

text: Yes, you can merge patient records with conflicting data in ZOLL Billing. However, you must resolve the conflict before merging the records. For example, if the data used for the same payer differs in some respect, you will see a conflict. You must resolve this conflict before you can merge the records.

text.text: What happens to the claims associated with merged patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you merge patient records, all claims associated with the records remain the same. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number, in their Inbox.

text.text: Can users still access claims associated with merged patient records in ZOLL Billing after the merge

text: Yes, users can still access claims associated with merged patient records in ZOLL Billing after the merge.

text.text: Is it possible to undo a merge operation in ZOLL Billing if needed?

text: Yes, it is possible to undo a merge operation in ZOLL Billing. To do this, you must first restore the patient record that was merged. You can then merge the patient records again, but this time select the option to keep the original patient record.

text.text: How to duplicate Patient Records

text: To duplicate patient records, you can use the Merge Patient functionality on the Account page. When a duplicate is detected, a yellow banner displays at the top of the page for the patient account you are viewing. You can only select one record at a time to merge into the existing patient record. You can merge as many patient records as needed until all the duplicates are gone.

text: If you see TBD in the "Claim #" column, it means that the import was successful but the system was unable to verify the patient account.

text.text: How can I access the Merge History to track merged patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: To access the Merge History, you can click the **View merge history** link on the patient's **Account** page. This will display a list of all merged patient records for the account you are viewing. You can also restore a merged patient record at any time after it is merged with another.

text.text: How do I merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing?

text: To merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing, you can use the Merge Patients feature to consolidate as many patient records as you wish into one patient record. You can also merge patient records by clicking the "Merge" button on the Edit Patient page. The system will merge the two patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID. You can also view all merged records using the Merge History on the Edit Patient page.

text.text: Can you walk me through the process of consolidating duplicate patient records using Merge Patient in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To merge duplicate patient records in ZOLL Billing, you can use the Merge Patients feature to consolidate as many patient records as you wish into one patient record.

1. On the **Patients** page, click the **Merge Patients** button.
2. In the **Merge Patients** dialog box, select the patient records that you want to merge.
3. Click the **Merge** button.

The system will merge the selected patient records into one patient record with a new patient ID. You can also view all merged records using the Merge History on the Edit Patient page.
